intro: Bartlettina sordida, commonly known as the blackleaf yarrow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky, arid environments and has small, narrow leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow to orange in color and bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators. Bartlettina sordida is known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
